subject: RE: [junit] Naming convention for TestAll classes
msgSnippet: Name them after the packages themselves. e.g.  com.foo.database.tests contains all tests for com.foo.database as well as a suite called _DatabasePackageTests
messageBody:
Name them after the packages themselves.

e.g. com.foo.database.tests contains all tests for com.foo.database as
well as a "suite" called _DatabasePackageTests or
ComFooDatabasePackageTests or ...

You get the idea.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----Original Message-----
From: drc@... [mailto:drc@...]
Sent: Wednesday, November 21, 2001 11:22 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Naming convention for TestAll classes


Hello All,
I build Test classes in many packages and now I want make some
AllTest classes on different level of package hierarchy and in
different packages (and one root AllTest class too). These TestAll
classes can compose all test in subpackages.
But I am confused about naming convention for these classes. For root
Test class it's simple, name can be AllTest or TestAll, but what
names can I assign to other? I looked for some convention, but there
are only convention for packages or method naming, not for this
problem. Have somebody some experience with this?

Example package structure (each level with few Test classes):
A
A.a
A.a.1.xxx
A.a.2.yyy
A.b
A.b.1.xxx
A.b.2.xxx

If I name all test classes composing some other test as "TestAll",
there can be confusion later (many classes with name "TestAll"), if I
name it "TestAllXXX", where XXX is name of last level of package,
there can be still packages with same name of the last level.
Assigning name as TestAll_A_a_1 (thus full name of package in name of
class) is for me too long. Some advice?

Thanx

Zdenek Smid
